intro: Ericameria cuneata var. spathulata, commonly known as the broadleaf ericameria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and yellow, disk-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in chaparral and scrub habitats, where it contributes to local biodiversity and ecological stability.
